responses:

JCU Singapore Library supports students with resources, services, and expert assistance during operating hours. Librarians are available on-site or via LibChat when JCU Australia is open

🧸Psychology Clinic
The JCU Singapore Psychology Clinic provides confidential therapy ($25/hour)and assessments($300, all-inclusive) for students and public, including children, adolescents, adults, and families. Income-based discounts/waivers available
- ⌚Hours: Mon-Fri (9AM-5:30PM)
- 📧Email: psyclinic-singapore@jcu.edu.au
- 📞Phone: +65 6709 3762
- 🏢Location: Block B, B1-03

🤝Student Affairs
Your first point of contact for general enquiries such as Enrolment, Course Fees, Scholarship, Timetable, Attendance, etc.
- ⌚Hours: Mon-Fri (9AM-6PM), Sat (9AM-1PM)

The Student Careers Office helps boost employability through internships, workshops, and personalized support—including career counseling, job search strategies, and resume reviews—to prepare students for their dream jobs

🕒Orientation week will take place from 6th to 17th January 2025. JCU Orientation helps you:
- 🏫Discover campus
- ☘️Connect with peers
- 🫂Discover support services
- 💕Meet new friends

patterns: difference between the part-time and full-time
pros and cons of part-time study
responses:
🌻Part-time schedules are designed for specific programs (e.g., Part-Time Diploma, Bachelor, and Master courses in fields like Psychological Science and Business).
🌷Full-time schedules cover a wider range, including Business, Social Health, Sciences, Technology, Foundation Programs, and Study Abroad.
🐨JCU 101 is an introduction session that walks students through the essentials of studying at JCU, including academic expectations, student support, and campus life.

📌🦁James Cook University Singapore is located at 149 Sims Drive, Singapore 387380.
You can find it on Google Maps : https://goo.gl/maps/5HVrYhdd5qJ2
🌺DigiLearn is James Cook University's virtual learning environment.

✔️You must complete JCU GetStarted before attending the DigiLearn Workshops.
- 💻Make sure to use a laptop or personal computer for DigiLearn workshops.
- 📵Mobile phones and iPads are not recommended.

Ⓜ️Pre-Orientation Essentials
🖊️1. Sign all admission documents (Offer Letter, Student Contract)
2. 🖋️Complete Student Pass formalities (if international)
3. 🙋🏻‍♀️🙋🏻‍♂️Attend Reporting + Document Verification sessions
4. ✔️Set up JCU accounts (GetStarted, Student Email)
5. 🫳🏻Collect Student ID Card
6. ⬇️🤳🏻Download academic calendars + payment deadlines

🔒🗝️Set up your password on JCU GetStarted with your 8-digit Student ID.
🔑You can find your Student ID on the top right-hand corner of Offer Letter.
📱Contact the Admissions Office for assistance.
📨Log into your JCU Student Email account regularly. This is your official communication channel with any staff from JCU. Make sure to check it for important updates.
⏬Download the JCU Calendars to view important dates. You can either print them out or note them down in your diary to stay on top of key deadlines.

🗓️Orientation Week Guide
- ✔️Attend Welcome Sessions + JCU 101
- ✔️Activate LearnJCU + eStudent accounts
- 🤔Configure Office 365 + eduroam WiFi
- 💵Make first fee payment (international students)
- ®️Register for AccessAbility if needed
- ⭐Explore library/IT services + transportation options

⚙️Log into LearnJCU to find information related to your subjects. You will find:
- 📚textbooks,
- 📑assessment topics,
- ‼️deadlines,
- ⭐grading information provided by your lecturers.

💸Make your first installment of course fees and International Student Registration fees (if applicable) as per the payment advice in the Student Contract.
✔️If you require an extension, submit the Request for Student Finance form.
®️Register for AccessAbility Services if you have a disability, health condition, or injury that might impact your studies. ✔️This service can provide the support and accommodations you need.

❗Week 1 Priorities
1. ☑️Review all Subject Outlines in LearnJCU
2. ✅Confirm timetable via eStudent
3. ☑️Note assessment deadlines + grading criteria
4. ✅Collect Student ID if pending
5. ☑️Attend Learning Center orientation
6. ✅Setup regular email checking routine

‼️Week 2 Focus Areas
- ☑️Start assignments using InfoSkills Toolkit
- ✅Connect with assigned Student Ambassador
- ☑️Explore JCU Interest Groups/Clubs
- ✅Bookmark Current Students portal
- ☑️Attend DigiLearn workshops
- ✅Verify transportation arrangements

❕Critical Week 3 Deadline
Census Date next week - Last chance to:
☑️1. Withdraw without financial liability
✅2. Drop subjects without academic penalty
☑️3. Change enrollment status
Contact Enrolments Office for assistance

🦜Familiarize yourself with various student services at JCU, including:
- ☑️AccessAbility Services
- ✅Accommodation
- ☑️Careers Services
- ✅Counselling
- ☑️Student Affairs
- ✅JCU Student Council
- ☑️Learning Advisors
- ✅Library Services
- ☑️ICT Team
😺Explore the various transportation options to and from JCU Singapore, including public transport. 😸You can also benefit from transport concessions if you use public transport regularly.

🐯Subject Outlines are available on LearnJCU. They provide crucial information about your course, such as the lecturer's contact details, consultation hours, academic expectations, and assessment guidelines.

🐳International Students Must:
☑️1. Maintain 90% attendance for Student Pass
✅2. Report address changes within 14 days
☑️3. Renew Student Pass 1 month before expiry
✅4. Keep insurance coverage valid
☑️5. Pay fees by deadlines
Contact Admissions for visa queries
🐻Visit the Learning Centre to access online resources, free short courses, and workshops aimed at improving your writing, referencing, time management, and learning techniques.
🐻‍❄️Log into eStudent to view your enrolment details, check your class schedule, and track your academic progress. It's your portal for all things related to your enrollment and results.
🐼If you require an extension for paying your course fees or other fees, you can submit a 'Request for Student Finance' form to seek assistance or contact the Student Finance office.

🦝The Census Date is an important deadline that typically falls in the third week of your studies. If you wish to withdraw from a subject or courses, you must do so before this date to avoid incurring fees or academic penalties.
🐲You can collect your JCUS Student ID card during the Verification of Document (Individual) session or as part of your orientation week activities.
